data.source_question: What letter did not Washington present to Saint-Pierre ?
data.article: (French_and_Indian_War) Jacques Legardeur de Saint-Pierre, who succeeded Marin as commander of the French forces after the latter died on October 29, invited Washington to dine with him. Over dinner, Washington presented Saint-Pierre with the letter from Dinwiddie demanding an immediate French withdrawal from the Ohio Country. Saint-Pierre said,
He told Washington that France's claim to the region was superior to that of the British, since René-Robert Cavelier, Sieur de La Salle had explored the Ohio Country nearly a century earlier.
data.declarative_sentence: The letter did not Washington present to Saint - Pierre.
data.new_question: Do the letter did not Washington present to Saint - Pierre?

data.source_question: Which is more costly, formal, or informal imperialism?
data.article: (Imperialism) The definition of imperialism has not been finalized for centuries and was confusedly seen to represent the policies of major powers, or simply, general-purpose aggressiveness. Further on, some writers[who?] used the term imperialism, in slightly more discriminating fashion, to mean all kinds of domination or control by a group of people over another. To clear out this confusion about the definition of imperialism one could speak of
imperialism, the first meaning physical control or

while the second implied less direct rule though still containing perceivable kinds of dominance. Informal rule is generally less costly than taking over territories formally. This is because, with informal rule, the control is spread more subtly through technological superiority, enforcing land officials into large debts that cannot be repaid, ownership of private industries thus expanding the controlled area, or having countries agree to uneven trade agreements forcefully.
data.declarative_sentence: Informal rule is more costly, formal, or informal imperialism.
data.new_question: Is informal rule more costly, formal, or informal imperialism?

data.source_question: How long did it take to improve on Sir Isaac Newton's laws of motion?
data.article: (Force) Philosophers in antiquity used the concept of force in the study of stationary and moving objects and simple machines, but thinkers such as Aristotle and Archimedes retained fundamental errors in understanding force. In part this was due to an incomplete understanding of the sometimes non-obvious force of friction, and a consequently inadequate view of the nature of natural motion. A fundamental error was the belief that a force is required to maintain motion, even at a constant velocity. Most of the previous misunderstandings about motion and force were eventually corrected by Galileo Galilei and Sir Isaac Newton. With his mathematical insight, Sir Isaac Newton formulated laws of motion that were not improved-on for nearly three hundred years. By the early 20th century, Einstein developed a theory of relativity that correctly predicted the action of forces on objects with increasing momenta near the speed of light, and also provided insight into the forces produced by gravitation and inertia.
data.declarative_sentence: It took to improve on Sir Isaac Newton's laws of motion for nearly three hundred years.
data.new_question: Did it take to improve on Sir Isaac Newton's laws of motion for nearly three hundred years?

data.source_question: Funding limitations allowed CSNET to be what ?
data.ground_truth: role in spreading awareness of, and access to, national networking and was a major milestone on the path to development of the global Internet
data.article: (Packet_switching) The Computer Science Network (CSNET) was a computer network funded by the U.S. National Science Foundation (NSF) that began operation in 1981. Its purpose was to extend networking benefits, for computer science departments at academic and research institutions that could not be directly connected to ARPANET, due to funding or authorization limitations. It played a significant role in spreading awareness of, and access to, national networking and was a major milestone on the path to development of the global Internet.
data.declarative_sentence: Funding limitations allowed CSNET to be a valuable resource.
data.new_question: Did funding limitations allow CSNET to be a valuable resource?

data.source_question: Boycotting, refusing to pay taxes, sit ins, and draft dodging all make what harder?
data.article: (Civil_disobedience) Some forms of civil disobedience, such as illegal boycotts, refusals to pay taxes, draft dodging, distributed denial-of-service attacks, and sit-ins, make it more difficult for a system to function. In this way, they might be considered coercive. Brownlee notes that
The Plowshares organization temporarily closed GCSB Waihopai by padlocking the gates and using sickles to deflate one of the large domes covering two satellite dishes.
data.declarative_sentence: Boycotting, refusing to pay taxes, sit ins, and draft dodging all make for a system to function.
data.new_question: Boycotting, refusing to pay taxes, sit ins, Do and draft dodging all make for a system to function?

data.source_question: Who was added to party as Washington went on the way?
data.ground_truth: Jacob Van Braam as an interpreter; Christopher Gist, a company surveyor working in the area; and a few Mingo led by Tanaghrisson
data.source_answer: jacob van braam as an interpreter; christopher gist,
data.article: (French_and_Indian_War) Governor Robert Dinwiddie of Virginia was an investor in the Ohio Company, which stood to lose money if the French held their claim. To counter the French military presence in Ohio, in October 1753 Dinwiddie ordered the 21-year-old Major George Washington (whose brother was another Ohio Company investor) of the Virginia Regiment to warn the French to leave Virginia territory. Washington left with a small party, picking up along the way Jacob Van Braam as an interpreter; Christopher Gist, a company surveyor working in the area; and a few Mingo led by Tanaghrisson. On December 12, Washington and his men reached Fort Le Boeuf.
data.declarative_sentence: Jacob van braam as an interpreter; christopher gist, was added to party as Washington went on the way.
data.new_question: Jacob van braam as an interpreter; christopher gist, was added to party as Washington went on the way?

data.source_question: What continent are the Canarian Islands off the coast of?
data.article: (Normans) Between 1402 and 1405, the expedition led by the Norman noble Jean de Bethencourt and the Poitevine Gadifer de la Salle conquered the Canarian islands of Lanzarote, Fuerteventura and El Hierro off the Atlantic coast of Africa. Their troops were gathered in Normandy, Gascony and were later reinforced by Castilian colonists.
data.declarative_sentence: Africa are the Canarian Islands off the coast of.
data.new_question: Are africa the Canarian Islands off the coast of?

data.source_question: Who purhcased the remaining 4 pacakages available to broadcasters?
data.article: (Sky_(United_Kingdom)) Following a lengthy legal battle with the European Commission, which deemed the exclusivity of the rights to be against the interests of competition and the consumer, BSkyB's monopoly came to an end from the 2007–08 season. In May 2006, the Irish broadcaster Setanta Sports was awarded two of the six Premier League packages that the English FA offered to broadcasters. Sky picked up the remaining four for £1.3bn. In February 2015, Sky bid £4.2bn for a package of 120 premier league games across the three seasons from 2016. This represented an increase of 70% on the previous contract and was said to be £1bn more than the company had expected to pay. The move has been followed by staff cuts, increased subscription prices (including 9% in Sky's family package) and the dropping of the 3D channel.
data.declarative_sentence: Sky purhcased the remaining 4 pacakages available to broadcasters.
data.new_question: Did sky purhcase the remaining 4 pacakages available to broadcasters?
